Articles.Content:
While we all patiently wait for .21 to come out I have run out of ideas of what to do!

I plan on continuing my youtube series with .21, but that's still at least a couple weeks out. I feel like playing ksp but do not want to get into anything long term, any idea's?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manned_Venus_Flyby

A fun little challenge.

This is what I plan on doing next day or so. Gonna do it right too http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/35611-WIP-v0-1-Wet-Workshops-Live-inside-your-fuel-tanks%E2%84%A2

This is what I plan on doing next day or so. Gonna do it right too http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/35611-WIP-v0-1-Wet-Workshops-Live-inside-your-fuel-tanks%E2%84%A2

Good luck! Hardest part of it is getting the return trajectory for the Kerbin return right.

Well thank you guys for the suggestions... What I ended up doing... Started to work on the Eve flyby then got side tracked building planes (don't ask how that happened ) anyway I am now focusing on building decent planes and Air to Launch systems!

Help me get these campaigns ready for .21 players who intend to start playing them when .21 comes out.

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Campaigns

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manned_Venus_Flyby

A fun little challenge.

I'm so doing this tomorrow. I just finished my first Eve landing tonight!

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sundiver_(space_mission) My suggestion. It just takes a big pile of delta-v and a couple trips out past Jool/Eeloo.

Kinda feels a bit like we're in limbo, doesn't it? I'm deorbiting my stations, bringing kerbals home from Jool and Duna, fiddling a bit with station designs, but don't feel able to build anything new because I know it'll all be lost.

The solution is to run multiple installs of KSP. I've got a crewed grand tour going at the moment that's gone completely Kerbal but I'm not quite willing to give up on yet. If .21 comes out tomorrow (hypothetically, yeah right) I'd just do a separate install & see if I lose interest. My Steam install is actually still at .19, I haven't touched since the last update when a lot of mods broke and (despite following the instructions to stop it) Steam wouldn't let me play without updating.

The solution is to run multiple installs of KSP. I've got a crewed grand tour going at the moment that's gone completely Kerbal but I'm not quite willing to give up on yet. If .21 comes out tomorrow (hypothetically, yeah right) I'd just do a separate install & see if I lose interest. My Steam install is actually still at .19, I haven't touched since the last update when a lot of mods broke and (despite following the instructions to stop it) Steam wouldn't let me play without updating.

That's kind of what I do...

I'll keep trucking along with .20 while all of the kinks are worked out in .21., its the same thing I did when the last update came out. See what's working and what's now and most likely wait for the first hot fix or patch to come out. I'll definitely do a separate install of .21 (don't use Steam so...) and play around with it, install mods that are working and such. Never know right.

I am taking the time to rebuild 3 of my space stations (ISS, Mir Complex and TopHat) so I can have the craft files handy though.

Im currently still trying to expand my empire, working on building a small city on minimus (currently landing HUGE spherical kethane tanks and moving them with a crane, difficult with such low gravity). that way when 0.21 rolls around i know how to do it for the most part. then i can focus on another celestial body.
